title: AttributeError: 'list' object has no attribute 'encode'
body:
**Describe the bug**
When I was trying to visualize on compare_classifiers_predictions_distribution, I got this error, saying 
AttributeError: 'list' object has no attribute 'encode'

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Run this command:
ludwig visualize --visualization compare_classifiers_predictions_distribution --ground_truth path/to/train.hdf5 --test_statistics results_1/test_statistics.json --predictions path/to/results_0

Please provide code, yaml definition file and a sample of data in order to entirely reproduce the issue.
The YAML file for the model

input_features:
    -
        name: data
        type: image
        encoder: resnet


preprocessing:
    image:
        in_memory: true
        resize_method: interpolate
        height: 640
        width: 480
        num_channels: 1
       
output_features:
    -
        name: emotions
        type: category
        
training:
    batch_size: 16
    epochs: 50 
    early_stop: 5
    learning_rate: 0.001


**Expected behavior**
the compare_classifiers_predictions_distribution plot to be visualized.

**Screenshots**
![error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51823700/62473898-b8220180-b76f-11e9-9a62-f4cc310cf211.png)


**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: iOS
 - Version 10.14.5
- Python version 3.7.3
- Ludwig version 0.2

**Additional context**
I had all the necessary files as described in the visualization page here https://uber.github.io/ludwig/user_guide/#compare_classifiers_predictions_distribution
but somehow this error persists.
